acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 48 hours EC50>792mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version), 2006).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (dermal route) of 5,600mg/kg (SIDS (2003)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the results of rat LD50 (oral route) of 2,030mg/kg representing the lower of the testing data, 2,030mg/kg and 3,340mg/kg (SIDS (2003)), and based on "reliable evidence showing that the results are within the range of Category 5."

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =1036mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as "flammable" by ICSC (1999).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on in vivo mutagenicity/genotoxicity tests and negative data on in vitro mutagenicity tests (chromosome aberration tests, mutation tests), described in SIDS (2003), NTP DB (Access on Feb., 2006).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Insufficient data available (no data available on reproductive effects)

respiratory_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause allergy or asthma symptoms or breathing difficulties if inhaled
respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in CERI Hazard Data 2001-33 (2002) of the human health effects: Allergic respiratory diseases were observed in 29% of the workers handling the substance, which is considered to cause respiratory sensitization.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "Severe eye irritation" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-33 (2002)), "the material should be considered severe eye irritants" (SIDS (2003)), and "TWAN into rabbit eye produced irritation scores of 105.6/110.0 on day 2 and 97.0/110.0 on day 7, a positive indicator that TWAN can produce ocular burns" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)) from the rabbit eye irritation test.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (4 hours): "mild irritation was observed" (SIDS (2003)), and "mild irritation" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-33 (2002)).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests (conducted in accordance with the maximization method and the murine lymph node assay) (CERI Hazard Data 2001-33 (2002)): Positive. The substance is considered to cause skin sensitization.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system, blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "allergic asthma, rhinitis, irritable respiratory conditions, pulmonary diseases, anemic conditions, late asthma, sneezing caused by irritation, nasal hemorrhage, cough, dyspnea" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-33 (2002)), "TMA-related pulmonary impairment, immune system responses" (SIDS (2003)), and the evidence from animal studies including "pulmonary hemorrhage, bronchial pneumonia" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-33 (2002)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "irritation to the upper respiratory tract (observed in those exposed to the substance)" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-33 (2002)), and the evidence from animal studies including "irregular respiration and temporary respiratory arrest (due probably to direct stimulation of the peripheral vagus nerve in the depth of the lungs)" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-33 (2002)), "red lesions, spots and fluid accumulation in the lungs" (SIDS (2003)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
